Description:
Fully Renovated 3 Bedroom Cottage circa 1870's
Set on approximately 1500sqm, this tastefully decorated and fully renovated 3 bedroom Miners Cottage with Studio is perfect for a weekend getaway or make it your permanent home. Home includes charming lead light windows, polished timber floors, high ceiling feature in living area and bay window in one bedroom, en-suite/ two way bathroom, all new appliances with instantaneous lpg gas hot water service. A quirky restored shed at the rear is an ideal studio, rumpus or man/lady cave. Carport for car or caravan.
For more information please contact:
Jo Millar 0438 081 301 or Angela Flowers 0437 456 908

Description:
Cottage with Unlimited Potential on 3792m2
Calling all renovators & handymen! Don't miss the opportunity to take advantage of the potential for this little gem. With the versatility for a number of configurations in the cottage and set on almost 1 acre, this property includes a Western Red Cedar studio/grannie flat, ideal for onsite accommodation while you work. Perhaps a few dollars spent can reap a few dollars earned as a holiday or full time lease. Plenty of room to build your own home (STCA) to the rear of the block with a rural outlook. Also included is 2 x storage sheds & double carport. Be quick to inspect.

Description:
Family Home In Picturesque Setting
Set on approx. 6.25 acres is this fantastic family home with space for everyone to enjoy. The hardiplank home features 4 bedrooms, large open plan kitchen, living and dining area, a wood heater, split system air conditioning and an undercover entertaining area where you can sit back and take in the beautiful surrounds. The bedrooms are spacious with the master containing a built in robe. The kitchen offers timber benchtops, duel fuel cooking and ample cupboard space.
Externally, you will be impressed with the multiple possibilities available to you! The acreage allows plenty of grazing space for stock and plenty of play space for the kids. There are a number of sheds including a double garage, wood shed, 3 bay machinery shed and a large carport. Work from home, tinker in the sheds or create your own man cave! The house yard is well fenced and secure for pets, and the undercover entertaining area is fly proof so you can relax outside in all seasons and is complimented by large decking spaces around the home.
Just a short drive from the Clunes township and school bus pick up at the front gate, the chance to live the country life can finally be realised! The home is connected to town water and has a 20 panel, 5kw solar system meaning little to no power bills and you can finally life the self sustainable lifestyle! Inspect ASAP!
Insights: 50 Fairview Drive, Clunes VIC 3370 was last sold in 2015 and 11 other 4 bedroom house in Clunes have recently been sold.

Description:
Crompton' - Stunning Period Home on Extra Large Allotment
With original rock walls and added seclusion via a private hedge, this circa 1910 property is presented with enormous intrigue and excitement. Bursting with significant history and style, this home displays a double columned return veranda, leadlight doors and original chimneys standing proud above the newly replaced iron roof. Old red brick paving, manicured lawns and garden along with excellent vehicle and/or machinery cover via a large shed, massive workshop, and high clearance carport make the grounds very serviceable and appealing.
Further to this, a wood shed, garden shed, large bungalow or studio, plus raised vegetable gardens for those wishing for fresh ready to pick' goodies are just some of the exterior features. Arbours, awnings and leafy recesses all add to the character of this amazing garden and landmass of 1800m2. Corner block positioned, the yard has driveway access via Galloway Court.
Internally, the home, with 12ft ceilings, has been uplifted with a fresh light palette with cosy plush carpet providing a touch of 21st century living. Original honeycomb floorboards have been treated with respect in the family and dining room, with the kitchen offering a bespoke timeless design with stainless steel 900mm freestanding cooker, shaker style cabinetry and country style. An original cellar offers that something extra for wine buffs. Three bedrooms are very generous in size, with the master boasting a massive built in robe. Fresh, light and well presented, the family bathroom offers the ideal configuration while a further shower has been combined within the large laundry facilities for added convenience. Warmed through the many open fire places, this home also offers heating/ cooling options via the strategically placed split system. Situated on the edge of the town precinct the property is connected to town sewer and water.
This delightful home is set in the gorgeous historic township of Clunes just 10 minutes to Creswick and 30 minutes to Ballarat city. Be sure to chat with our agents regarding this remarkable property and/or organise an immediate inspection.
Insights: 31 Talbot Road, Clunes VIC 3370 was last sold in 2018 and 17 other 3 bedroom house in Clunes have recently been sold.

Description:
Vendor Says Sell!!!
Situated just outside the popular township of Clunes is this magnificent family home on approx. 6.5 acres. Featuring 5 bedrooms, master with walk in robe and ensuite, 3 living areas and a fantastic kitchen and dining area featuring parquetry flooring, this home offers space for everyone to enjoy. The bedrooms are a good size and the home has Brivus ducted cooling, a wood heater and a gas heater to add to the comfort.
Externally, you will be impressed with what is on offer. There are 3 paddocks - ideal for grazing stock or for the kids to play in, large feature dam full of yabbies and an enclosed backyard with pool, cubby house, undercover entertaining area and fernery, bungalow or storage room and plenty of space for pets. Other shedding includes a dog enclosure, chicken coup, 1 horse box, a garden shed, a single garage, a single carport, another single shed which would be ideal for a workshop or storage room, a 4 car carport with high clearance for caravans or horse floats and plenty of other yard space at the front and rear for moving vehicles and trailers.
The space and privacy on offer is magnificent as well as the size of the home which would be ideal for families and for entertaining. The home is connected to a 5kw, 20 solar panel system meaning bills are no longer an issue! Adding to the package is a bus stop nearby on Fairview Road. Inspect ASAP to appreciate what is on offer and we are sure you will agree that it represents great value for money in today's market.

Description:
Lavish Home or Business Opportunity
The historic Duke of Edinburgh Hotel (formerly Exchange Hotel) was established Circa 1853 in the then Commercial end of Fraser Street. The name change came about after a visit by Prince Alfred, (the Duke of Edinburgh) to the goldfields, and Clunes in 1869. It is a single storey brick building with many period features dating from the 1850s, including a large cellar, a unique ladies snug, original Baltic Pine wall panelling and flooring. The hotel was de-licensed in 1919 and it became the family home of the Roberts family. Extensive renovation added, new living/dining rooms, and bedroom ensuites. Original brick walls frame a largely perennial and rose garden. The property opened to the public as a hosted bed & breakfast in 1999 and has become an integral part of the tourism, and community life of Clunes, Vendors are offering a walk in/walk out arrangement whether it be to continue running as a B & B, convert into consulting rooms or use as the family home. Check us out on www.tripadvisor.com.au.
Insights: 19 Fraser Street, Clunes VIC 3370 was last sold in 2015.

Description:
Central Clunes Block with Views
With very little through traffic, this quiet location offers views across the township and provides the perfect land arrangement for your architect.
Set in the heart of the iconic township of Clunes, this site offers power, water, sewer, storm water and telephone facilities. Just a short stroll to the local showground, station and main street, these generous allotments of 1030m2 & 1020m2, ideal size to begin your country dream. Clunes is dotted with antique and collectable stores, vineyards and wineries, rustic bed & breakfasts and scenic walks, the perfect destination for bushwalkers, gold prospectors, history buffs or families seeking to escape to the country.
If you wish to build your getaway ranch or the extravagant family home, this site offers excellent commuting provisions with a short 30 minute drive to Ballarat or an 1hr 20mins drive west of Melbourne. An advantage to this purchase, is there is a further building site adjoining; which creates one massive building site or the option to purchase one or the other. It's is not often we can offer two blocks side by side. Call our agents today for further details of this unique opportunity.

The entertaining area is one of the main attractions featuring a bricked open fireplace for year round use with t.v points for watching sporting events outdoors. Also includes 5 Bedrooms, en-suite & walk-in robe to master, 3 Living areas which includes huge games room with separate access. North facing bay windows to formal lounge takes full advantage of the winter sun.. Solar HWS has electric backup. Keep cosy with wood heating or split system. Easy care landscaped gardens with vegie garden and 2 level chicken coup. Good shedding plus double carport. Conveniently located within walking distance to all that Clunes has to offer.
For inspection please call Jo Millar on 0438 081 301
Insights: 82 Bailey Street, Clunes VIC 3370 was last sold in 2015 and 3 other 5 bedroom house in Clunes have recently been sold.

Description:
Renovated Clunes 4 Bedroom Home on 1700m2
This four bedroom home sits in a high and dry position approx. 950 metres walk from the Clunes Bowling Club and Town Centre. As you can see by the photos the home has been extensively renovated throughout and would make an ideal permanent home or investment. The hardi-plank home offers a front veranda and 2 car tandem deep carport plus a large paved outdoor entertaining area.
The home itself features four bedrooms, master complete with a walk-in robe, ensuite and toilet. The second and third bedrooms have built-in robes. The kitchen features gas cooktop, electric oven, dishwasher and plenty of cupboard and bench space in place. The kitchen, dining and lounge room is all open plan and features floating timber floors plus a freestanding wood heater. At the east side of the home you have the three bedrooms, spacious laundry, modern bathroom and second toilet plus storage cupboard in the hallway.
Outside you have a U-shaped driveway and a large backyard for the kids to play. Services connected to the home include town water and sewerage, mains power, electric hot water service with ADSL internet available. The home is rented to excellent tenants at $280 per week until September 2015. The tenants have indicated they would like to stay on. The Township of Clunes features a primary school, supermarket, recreation oval and is just 30 minutes drive to Ballarat.
Insights: 46 Smeaton Road, CLUNES VIC 3370 was last sold in 2015 and 11 other 4 bedroom house in CLUNES have recently been sold.

Description:
Historic Freehold Shop and Dwelling
Offered with vacant possession this splendid example of goldfields architecture this freehold shop and dwelling is situated on a 220m2 allotment in the main street of this historic township and could lend itself to a multitude of purposes. With abundant lower level of retail space (currently utilised a caf/restaurant) the potential uses for this property are only limited by your imagination. The upper level residence accommodates 2BRs formal lounge bathroom and kitchen and there is a private courtyard to the rear. Call today to inspect this rare opportunity

Description:
100 acres right on the township boundary of Clunes.
Approximately 1.5 kms to the town centre, is the opportunity to own your own piece of the Central Victorian countryside with views of surrounding hills including Mt Beckworth. Remains of the old farmhouse serve as a reminder of times past, still a an ideal location to make your new home the future (STCA). Ideal for stock, crop or mixed farming. Includes good fencing, extra access to all paddocks from lane ways and shelter belts for stock. Power, water & phone all available. Zoned rural living and farming.
For more information please contact Jo Millar 0438 081 301

Description:
Convenience and Country Living Combined Together
Become a part of a beautiful community and surround yourself with good country living. This pretty white weatherboard home offers you a life of convenience and low maintenance. Designed and built with a simple floorplan, this clever two bedroom home offers an open plan with a stylish finish. Flooded with crisp clean colours and smart quality appliances, this property of 902m2 offers a very flexible adventure. Run some chickens; grow some vegetables or even plant an orchard- this allotment certainly offers the space.
The generous master bedroom features a lovely bay window with loads of natural light and a walk-in-robe, whilst bedroom two offers a touch of luxury with built-in robes. The family bathroom is well proportioned and is positioned perfectly to service the entire home, whilst the European laundry is tucked away to save space in the more important living zones. Complete with a cosy fan forced wood heater, the lounge is an ideal size for guests to gather or further mingle in the adjoining stylish kitchen. Electric cooking and plenty of cabinetry ensure this area functions well and is planned perfectly for the chef to intermingle whilst preparing the meals.
If crawling out of bed to take the children to school is a problem, then no more, with the reputable Clunes Primary School just across the way - an ideal home for a young family. A solid investment property with a rental return of: $190 per week. This home is a good buy in a good location, therefore be sure to arrange an inspection today.
Insights: 6 Cameron Street, CLUNES VIC 3370 was last sold in 2015 and 7 other 2 bedroom house in CLUNES have recently been sold.
